column4: I have windows xp installed and using my entire HDD, is it possible to partition my pc so I can install ubuntu on this PC for dual booting?
yes
the install process will help you repartition
it uses gparted, open source partitioning program like partition magic
you mean the ubuntu installer will let me slice this sucker in half? amazing.
yep :)
one more Q, do i need to reboot into the cd or do i partition and install while in windows? I guess i would need to reboot, wouldnt make sense to slice up something in use already.
you do it when you're installing
but as you were told defrag first
I suggest you install virtualbox
install virtualbox, then install windows in a vm environment, most developers use this method.
oh really? not slow at all?
is it free?
yes it's free www.virtualbox.org
if you need USB2.0 support and extra features install the one from sun, the OSE version is in the repo's but is not as feature filled as the regular.
personally I run 2 vm's one xp and one windows 2003 server
Thanks, I just need photoshop and illustrator though, perhaps visual studio but I can't imagine I'll be doing any C# work anymore.
the good thing about vm's it won't affect anything else, imagine an OS inside it's own personal bubble anything happens, delete it and start over.
photoshop CS2 works under wine in ubuntu
but yes install virtualbox for all those packages
you're perfect.
or just boot each one and check :)
